column2: Protects from disclosure information that has been deemed classified under critieria established by an Executive order to be kept secret in the interest of national derfense or foreign policy.
Protects information about individuals in personnel and medical files and similar when the disclosure of such information would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.
column3: National Association of Retired Federal Employees v. Horner, 879 F.2d 873, 874 (D.C. Cir. 1989)
